definition: to win instant success (idiom)/to start off successfully
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
variant of 炮[pao4]
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating
cannon/CL:座[zuo4]/firecracker
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
echo/sound/noise/to make a sound/to sound/to ring/loud/classifier for noises

sentences.english: The show was an overnight success on Broadway .
sentences.chinese: 在百老汇的演出一炮打响。

sentences.english: Sun's debut album was a runaway hit.
sentences.chinese: 孙燕姿的首张专辑一炮打响。

sentences.english: You have all the infermation you require to do a bang-up job in Washington.
sentences.chinese: 你握有你需要的可在华盛顿一炮打响的全部材料。
这是一首一炮打响的歌曲。

sentences.english: Talented he, will in the imperial examinations in gun fired?
sentences.chinese: 才华盖世的他，会在科举考试中一炮打响吗？

to rise to fame
everyone present applauds/universal acclaim/a standing ovation/to bring the house down
(fig.) opening shot
to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
sensational effect/wild reaction

to become famous/to become notorious
to be published (of art, literary works etc)/to come out/to take shape/to see the light of day
to make a name/to become famous
to sell strongly/to be in great demand

understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name

first sign of budding talent/to display one's ability for the first time
success at one go/to succeed at the first attempt
